User Name: IAEA - International Atomic Energy Agency âš›ï¸
Text: Director General @RafaelMGrossi continues his consultations and other efforts aimed at agreeing and implementing a nuclear safety and security zone around the #Zaporizhzhya NPP as soon as possible. He is expected to travel to #Kyiv and #Moscow next week.

User Name: IAEA - International Atomic Energy Agency âš›ï¸
Text: Separately today, IAEA experts at #ZNPP said several explosions were again heard in the vicinity of ZNPP. As w/ previous explosions reported by IAEA this week, they are believed to have been caused by landmines, but did not directly impact plant's safety or security systems.

User Name: IAEA - International Atomic Energy Agency âš›ï¸
Text: IAEA Director General @RafaelMGrossi expressed the hope that Mr Murashov will return to his family safely and promptly and will be able to resume his important functions at the plant.

User Name: IAEA - International Atomic Energy Agency âš›ï¸
Text: IAEA has been in contact w/ relevant authorities seeking clarifications on temporary detention of #Ukraine #Zaporizhzhya NPP Murashov; detention has very significant impact on the individual & the 7 nuclear safety & security pillars, @RafaelMGrossi said. https://t.co/KYluTWhsfZ https://t.co/oPQQuHiSX8

User Name: IAEA - International Atomic Energy Agency âš›ï¸
Text: IAEA Director General @RafaelMGrossi confirmed that the IAEA, in line with its nuclear safety mandate, has been actively seeking clarifications and hopes for a prompt and satisfactory resolution of this matter.

User Name: IAEA - International Atomic Energy Agency âš›ï¸
Text: After receiving information about the detention of Ihor Murashov, Director General of #Ukraineâ€™s #Zaporizhzhya Nuclear Power Plant, the IAEA has been in contact with the relevant authorities and has been informed that Mr Murashov is in temporary detention.

Text: Director General @rafaelmgrossi will on Tuesday issue a report about the safety, security and safeguards situation in #Ukraine â€” including findings from his mission to the #ZNPP â€” and later the same day brief the @UN Security Council (#UNSC) about the mission to the plant.

User Name: IAEA - International Atomic Energy Agency âš›ï¸
Text: Also today, four IAEA experts left #ZNPP as planned after several days of essential safety, security & safeguards work. Two others remain as part of a continuing presence at the site.

User Name: IAEA - International Atomic Energy Agency âš›ï¸
Text: #Ukraine informed IAEA that a back-up power line between #Zaporizhzhya NPP & a thermal power station was deliberately disconnected to extinguish a fire. The line was not damaged & for safety #ZNPP is receiving electricity from its sole operating reactor. https://t.co/leL4knrZWn https://t.co/UuACtl6d4k

User Name: IAEA - International Atomic Energy Agency âš›ï¸
Text: Why the IAEA needs to be allowed to go to Ukraineâ€™s #Zaporizhzya Nuclear Power Plant? Director General @RafaelMGrossi spells out the reasons to #UNSC. Read our summary: https://t.co/MFEiLE0wSD https://t.co/nym9gAJu5d

User Name: IAEA - International Atomic Energy Agency âš›ï¸
Text: "I thank #UN Secretary General @antonioguterres for his unwavering support, and the #UNSC for its indispensable focus on global safety and security."â€”@rafaelmgrossi at UNSC

User Name: IAEA - International Atomic Energy Agency âš›ï¸
Text: "Our on-site presence at #Zaporizhzya NPP would provide a stabilizing influence. We have been ready since June, but due to political factors and other considerations, a mission has not been possible. We cannot allow such factors to delay us any longer."â€”@rafaelmgrossi at #UNSC

User Name: IAEA - International Atomic Energy Agency âš›ï¸
Text: "IAEA experts would assess physical damage at #Zaporizhzya NPP, determine if main & backup safety and security systems are functional, and evaluate working conditions of control room staff. A mission would also allow us to perform urgent safeguards work."â€”@rafaelmgrossi at #UNSC

User Name: IAEA - International Atomic Energy Agency âš›ï¸
Text: "I ask that both sides of this armed conflict cooperate with the IAEA and allow for a mission to the #Zaporizhzya NPP as soon as possible. Time is of the essence, so I propose to hold this mission as soon as possible."â€”@rafaelmgrossi at #UNSC

User Name: IAEA - International Atomic Energy Agency âš›ï¸
Text: "Based on most recent information provided by #Ukraine, IAEA experts have preliminarily assessed that there is no immediate threat to nuclear safety as a result of the shelling or other recent military actions. However, this could change at any moment."â€”@rafaelmgrossi at #UNSC

User Name: IAEA - International Atomic Energy Agency âš›ï¸
Text: "I remain very concerned about situation at #Zaporizhzya NPP and reiterate that any military actions jeopardizing nuclear safety & security must stop immediately. These military actions near such a large nuclear facility could have serious consequences."â€”@rafaelmgrossi at #UNSC

User Name: IAEA - International Atomic Energy Agency âš›ï¸
Text: "Recently, the situation at the nuclear power facilities, particularly at #Zaporizhzya, has become alarming. As of today, the plant has limited availability of offsite power due to damage from the shelling last week."â€”@rafaelmgrossi at #UNSC

User Name: IAEA - International Atomic Energy Agency âš›ï¸
Text: The IAEA has conducted 9 safeguards missions since the start of the war. 2 teams are in #Chornobyl now. â€”@rafaelmgrossi at #UNSC

User Name: IAEA - International Atomic Energy Agency âš›ï¸
Text: "I have led 2 missions of experts to #Ukraine to provide necessary assistance at nuclear facilities; the IAEA has coordinated offers of assistance from our Member States of items such as personal protective equipment and radiation monitors."â€”@rafaelmgrossi at #UNSC

User Name: IAEA - International Atomic Energy Agency âš›ï¸
Text: .@rafaelmgrossi at #UNSC: "Since 24 Feb IAEA has closely monitored the situation at nuclear facilities as well as activities involving radioactive sources & nuclear material in #Ukraine, focusing on implications for nuclear safety, security & safeguards." https://t.co/fmm6Li3dVQ

Text: In 1961, Cockcroft received the Atoms for Peace Award for contributions to the development or application of peaceful nuclear tech. The award was created in response to Eisenhowerâ€™s Atoms for Peace address to the @UN â€” a speech that played a pivotal part in the birth of the IAEA.

User Name: IAEA - International Atomic Energy Agency âš›ï¸
Text: In 1932 they bombarded lithium with protons and effectively split its nucleus into two helium atoms. It was the first time one element had been changed to another under full human control. This work earned them the 1951 @NobelPrize in Physics.

User Name: IAEA - International Atomic Energy Agency âš›ï¸
Text: Beginning in 1928, Cockcroft and fellow scientist Ernest Walton worked on the acceleration of protons using a particle accelerator.

User Name: IAEA - International Atomic Energy Agency âš›ï¸
Text: X-ray crystallography is critical in determining the structures of many biological molecules in order to understand their function.

User Name: IAEA - International Atomic Energy Agency âš›ï¸
Text: Hodgkin used this version of the technique to determine the atomic and molecular structures of penicillin, insulin, and vitamin B12. Her work on protein crystallography earned her the @NoblePrize in Chemistry in 1964.

User Name: IAEA - International Atomic Energy Agency âš›ï¸
Text: X-ray crystallography involves beams of X-rays hitting atoms of a crystal (like those found in materials such as salts, metals, minerals, and semiconductors), which are then diffracted into many different directions.

User Name: IAEA - International Atomic Energy Agency âš›ï¸
Text: Hodgkin is most well-known for pioneering methods in the field of X-ray crystallography. She was able to determine the three-dimensional structures of biomolecules using a new technique called X-ray crystallography, which she helped to advance.

Text:

Text: IAEA Director General @RafaelMGrossi has proposed to lead a visit to #Zaporizhzhya NPP after necessary consultations and at earliest possible opportunity. IAEA continues to adjust its safeguards activities, but situation will become unsustainable, an IAEA report on Thursday said.

Text: #Kharkiv: regulator confirmed reports of unexploded rocket near nuclear research facility; due to "constant shelling", it has not been possible to dispose of it. Facility's nuclear material is subcritical and the radioactive inventory is low. IAEA continues to monitor.
